description: man with creased forehead; slit eyes and mouth; yellow animal hair for eyebrows, moustache, and goatee; string ties flanking mouth; hinged jaw; has green and brown floral design cloth storage bag
text: This mask, one of several used in the ritual play "Okina" (literally, "old man"), represents a divine spirit rather than a human being. With a face creased with laughter and a broad smile, the mask suggests great benevolence and contentment. The mask's black color symbolizes earth and night. Kokushikijo_'s dance, performed by an actor holding a cluster of small golden bells, signifies wishes for an abundant harvest.
title: Kokushikijo_
